message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The condition described is hyperimmunoglobulinemia E syndrome, also known as Job syndrome. The hallmark of this condition is hyperimmunoglobulinemia E and eosinophilia. The boy also suffers from recurrent infections and takes antibiotic chemoprophylaxis. The characteristic symptoms of this condition are eosinophilia, eczema, and recurrent skin and lung infections, all of which are present in option B. Hay fever and bronchial asthma are not typically associated with this syndrome (not included in any options). Atopic dermatitis may be present, but it is not as characteristic as eczema. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) I, II, V.

We refer to a medical article on PubMed for help. According to the article, the hallmark symptoms of Job syndrome include hyperimmunoglobulinemia E, recurrent skin and lung infections, and eczema. Eosinophilia can also be present, but hay fever and bronchial asthma are not typically associated with Job syndrome. Therefore, the appropriate combination of symptoms is I (hyperimmunoglobulinemia E), II (eczema), and V (recurrent skin and lung infections), which is found in option B.
